name: Healthyfied
description: This Healthified recipe is perfect for those looking to enjoy a high-protein, high-fiber meal without sacrificing taste. Featuring boneless milkfish, fresh vegetables like eggplant, young corn, tomatoes, red onion, and string beans, and seasoned with thyme, pepper, and garlic powder, it's a nutritious option that doesn't skimp on flavor. Ideal for anyone wanting to keep their meals healthy and delicious.

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Boneless Milkfish under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Place on a baking tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the Eggplant, Young Corn, Tomatoes, and Fresh String Beans, then cut into desired pieces. Peel and finely chop the Red Onion.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Arrange the chopped vegetables around the Milkfish on the baking tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, beat the Eggs with Thyme, Pepper, and Garlic Powder.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Drizzle the Eggplant, Young Corn, Tomatoes, and String Beans with Extra Virgin Olive Oil and sprinkle with sea salt to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Dollop Butter and the beaten egg mixture over the Milkfish and vegetables.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Bake in the preheated oven until the Milkfish is cooked through and the vegetables are tender, about 20-25 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the Healthified warm, garnished with fresh thyme if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
